title: CVE-2017-5341 The OTV parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow in print-otv.c:otv_print()
content: Reported to the project maintainers in 2016. The function sig_print() did receive a correct caplen parameter value but didn't use it correctly which could cause a read outside of buffer. Fixed by https://github.com/the-tcpdump-group/tcpdump/commit/409ffe94529df3d8bb8258bf99586f821756cb29.
steps: Run tcpdump version before 4.9.0 to capture OTV (Overlay Transport Virtualization) packets.
Analyze the captured packets using the OTV parser in tcpdump, specifically triggering the otv_print() function.
vuln_description: The OTV parser in tcpdump before 4.9.0 has a buffer overflow in print-otv.c:otv_print(). The function sig_print() received a correct caplen parameter value but didn't use it correctly, which could cause a read outside of the buffer.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer overflow due to incorrect use of the caplen parameter in a single function. It does not require understanding of multiple components, complex states, or novel logic.
